thread.title: Russia to Float Out 1st Upgraded Borei-Class Strategic Sub in 2Q17
thread.title_full: Russia to Float Out 1st Upgraded Borei-Class Strategic Sub in 2Q17

title: Russia to Float Out 1st Upgraded Borei-Class Strategic Sub in 2Q17
text:
Russia to Float Out 1st Upgraded Borei-Class Strategic Sub in 2Q17 © Photo: "Sevmash" Press Service 0 182 1 0 Russia's Borei II-class Knyaz Vladimir nuclear-powered strategic submarine will be floated out in the second quarter of 2017, the United Shipbuilding Corporation (USC) said Friday. 
MOSCOW (Sputnik) — Knyaz Vladimir is the first Borei-class vessel being built under the modernized Project 955A program, which envisions a number of improvements including arming the sub with enhanced Bulava-M sea-launched intercontinental ballistic missiles. "Project 955A Borei-class Knyaz Vladimir nuclear-powered strategic submarine is expected to be floated out in the second quarter of this year. The commissioning will take place on schedule," USC Vice President for Military Shipbuilding Igor Ponomarev told Sputnik.
